item.description:
Do NOT sign up for this clinic unless you are fully committed to arriving BEFORE 5:30. There will be more offerings of this clinic on other days.

The Basic Doubles Skills Clinic is entry level in a series of free Boston Volleyball Meetup clinics for beginners through advanced doubles players. This is your chance to learn doubles!

This basic clinic is entry level for doubles, but this is not for beginning/inactive sixes volleyball players. If you haven't played 10 hours of volleyball in 2012, then you are not ready for this clinic. We expect you to serve a ball in-bounds 75% of the time. Intermediate/Advanced doubles players are also welcome. We focus on the highlighted basic skills listed below. After practicing these skills, you should be able to compete well at B level or above in local grass doubles tournaments.

The other clinics in this series cover Basic through Advanced skills.

The format of clinics are 80% drills, 20% instruction. Each clinic is two hours long. We run these outdoors on good-weather days only. As a bonus, we will provide you a net you can practice on after the clinic ends.

Coach Matt has been playing doubles for 20 years. He competes at AA level. He has learned volleyball coaching in the HITS and FullSpeed programs. Matt co-runs Meetup QK A/AA Doubles Tournaments with Brian Lee.

These clinics have limited spots available and are offered on multiple dates. Please sign up as an individual. If you wish to bring a guest, please have them register in Meetup and sign themselves up. Meetup and this clinic are free. Even if the event is full, do sign up on the wait-list, as there is a very good chance you'll get in. If you need to cancel, please do so at least 18 hours in advance, and better late than never. Priority for moving from wait-list to "Attending" are given to those who were on previous wait-lists. Previous no-shows are moved to the wait-list.

Please arrive on time or 15 minutes early. It is optional but would be appreciated if you show up 30 minutes early to help coach set up nets.

What you should bring:

• Outdoor shoes with nubby tread.

• Your outdoor volleyball. We prefer Spaulding King of the Beach or Wilson Official AVP. Please do not bring indoor volleyballs. Coach will bring extra volleyballs but they will be old.

• Water. There is no source of water near the site.

Coming by car, park in second lot past Eliot Bridge. Coming by public transit, exit at Harvard Square, then walk JFK across river, turn right immediately on bike path and walk one mile, crossing under Eliot bridge. We're past the kayak rental.

SKILLS LIST

Basic Skills (B level)

1. Serving

2. Body Position and Footwork

3. Bump Passing

4. Bump Setting

5. Roll Shot

 

Low Intermediate (BB level)

1. Overhand Digging

2. Poking

3. Cut Roll Shot

4. Three-meter hitting (mainly for men).

 

Intermediate Skills (A level)

1. Reading

2. Diving

3. Overhand Setting

4. Downward Spiking

 

Advanced Skills (AA level)

1. Blocking

2. Jump Serving

3. Beach Digging

4. Tooling
item.how_to_find_us: Between Soldiers Field Road and the River, near the kayak rental hut. Parking is free.
item.name: Basic Volleyball Doubles Skills Clinic
